document.title: Writing Awareness
document.abstract: The author argues that, by practicing embodied, metaphoric ethnography, educators can revise their roles in classroom social systems and so pursue the goals of critical pedagogy.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Gwen Gorzelsky is Assistant Professor of Urban Literacy at Wayne State University. She is researching the emotional and embodied aspects of writing instruction. This work has developed from the book she is writing on grassroots literate practices, Echoes Half Heard: Community Activists, Collective Movements.
